A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I thoroughly enjoyed the Rey and Kylo storyline. I feel that the theme of killing the past was good for series progression and I like how both characters ended up in the film. I think the death of Snoke and unimportant lineage of Rey add some realism to the series. 

That being said....

Rose. I've been trying to determine if I didn't like her because she was poorly written or didn't add value to the story. I decided I don't like her because she's just not a good actress.

Finn was a bit wasted. In TFA it's implied he's well trained and in this one they reinforce the whole janitor vibe and send him on some useless story. Imagine the CGI time and money they could have saved. 

Admittedly the movie does have a political vibe. It felt like Rian Johnson is preparing to run for office next year. 

The slow-motion cat and mouse game was especially boring. It only provided reasons for Poe to be wrong about things. Holdo was a boring and frustrating character 

I did like Leia's role (with the exception of her trip through space)\, her theme of passing the baton felt right. 

I liked Luke but I think we needed to see more of him teaching Rey. We didn't get a chance to see his light come back. He also lacked emotion facing Kylo Ren which was weird. 

The jokes. I'd say 30% of them landed. The rest just really killed the mood of serious scenes that would have otherwise been impactful. 

Last thing. I wanted more phasma. It's ridiculous that Finn defeats phasma again with his comical antics. Rian has a powerful woman already written into the story but decides to make her a joke and write four more. Phasma\, IMO\, was the biggest opportunity to show female empowerment and she just gets thrown into a joke-style death.
